CHAPTER 1341
Vacant Building and Structure Registration
1341.01   Purpose.
1341.02   Vacant building and structure registration.
1341.03   Notice to City of foreclosure filing; fee.
1341.04   Person responsible for maintenance in the event of foreclosure.
1341.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Unsafe structures - see BLDG. Ch.
1351
1341.01  PURPOSE.
   The purpose of this Chapter is to establish a program for identifying and
registering vacant residential and commercial buildings and structures; to
determine the responsibilities of owners of vacant buildings and structures,
and to speed the rehabilitation of the vacant buildings and structures. 
Shifting the cost of burden from the general citizenry to the owners of the
blighted buildings will be the result of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2015-022.  Passed 3-10-15.)
1341.02  VACANT BUILDING AND STRUCTURE REGISTRATION.
   (a)   The owner shall register with the Building Department not later than
ninety (90) days after a building or structure located in an area zoned for
residential or commercial use in the City becomes vacant or not later than
thirty (30) days after being notified by the Building Department of the
requirement to register based on evidence of vacancy, whichever event first
occurs.  Upon registration approval, the City shall issue a Vacant Building
Registration Certificate bearing emergency contact information and the owner
shall cause the certificate to be displayed on the main entrance door to the
building or structure.  The certificate shall expire after one year and if the
dwelling remains vacant the owner shall apply for a renewal certificate.
   (b)   The registration shall be submitted on forms provided by the Building
Department and shall include the following information supplied by the owner:
      (1)   The name(s), mailing address(es), telephone number(s) and email
address(es) of the owner or owners.
(Ord. 2015-022.  Passed 3-10-15.)
1341.03  NOTICE TO CITY OF FORECLOSURE FILING; FEE.
   (a)   Any person who files a complaint in any court of competent
jurisdiction for foreclosure involving real property located within the City of
Eastlake on which there is a building or structure shall notify the City of the
filing of the foreclosure complaint and shall file a complete copy of the
foreclosure complaint with the Chief Building Official within ten (10) days
after filing of the complaint with the relevant court.  The notice to the City
shall be on a form as prescribed by the Chief Building Official.
(Ord. 2015-022.  Passed 3-10-15.)
   (b)   A fee for filing a notice of foreclosure and registration of vacant
building(s) or structure(s) shall be $300.00 for a residential and/or
commercial building and shall be paid at the time the notice is filed with the
Chief Building Official.
(Ord. 2015-088.  Passed 11-24-15.)
1341.04  PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTENANCE IN THE EVENT OF FORECLOSURE.
   (a)   If the building or structure on the property that is the subject of a
foreclosure proceeding is vacant at the time the foreclosure complaint is filed
with a court of competent jurisdiction, then the person filing the foreclosure
complaint shall notify the City of the name, address and contact information
for the person who is responsible for maintaining the property in compliance
with all applicable provisions of the Codified Ordinances of the City of
Eastlake, and shall otherwise comply with all provisions of this Chapter.
   (b)   If the building or structure on the property that is the subject to a
foreclosure proceeding becomes vacant at any time after the foreclosure
complaint is filed with a court of competent jurisdiction, then the person
filing the foreclosure notice shall notify the City of the name, address and
contact information for the person who will be responsible for maintaining the
property in compliance with all the applicable provisions of the Codified
Ordinances of the City of Eastlake, and shall otherwise comply with all
provisions of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2015-022.  Passed 3-10-15.)
1341.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever fails to comply with any provision of this chapter or with any
requirement or regulation herein is guilty of a misdemeanor of the first
degree.
(Ord. 2015-022.  Passed 3-10-15.)
CHAPTER 1345
Mobile Home Parks
1345.01   Definitions.
1345.02   Parking of mobile homes restricted.
1345.03   Requirements for mobile home parks.
1345.04   Permitted accessory uses and buildings.
1345.05   Signs.
1345.06   Nonconforming mobile home parks.
1345.07   Compliance with other ordinances.
1345.08   Revision of plans.
1345.09   Health requirements.
1345.10   Daily record to be kept.
1345.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Manufactured home parks - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 3733
Trailer Park Districts - see P. & Z.
1151.08 et seq.
Underground utility installations - see BLDG. Ch.
1363
1345.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Mobile home" means any vehicle or similar portable structure having
been constructed with wheels, whether or not such wheels have been removed, and
having no foundation other than wheels, jacks or skirtings and so designed or
constructed as to permit permanent or extended term living quarters.
      (Ord. 2005-126.  Passed 12-6-05.)
   (b)   "Mobile home park" means any plot of ground that contains twenty or
more acres of ground under one ownership or unified control.
   (c)   "Unit" means a section of ground not less than 3,600 square feet of
unoccupied space in an area designated as the location for one mobile home.
      (Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.02  PARKING OF MOBILE HOMES RESTRICTED.
   (a)   No person shall park any mobile home on any street, alley, highway or
other public place, or on any tract of land owned by any person, occupied or
unoccupied, within the City, except as provided in this chapter.
   (b)   Emergency or temporary stopping or parking of mobile homes is
permitted on any street, alley or highway for not longer than one hour subject
to any other prohibitions, regulations and limitations imposed by the traffic
and parking regulations or ordinances for the street, alley or highway.
   (c)   No person shall park or occupy any mobile home on the premises of any
occupied dwelling or on any lot which is not a part of the premises of any
occupied building, either of which is situated outside an approved mobile home
park, except that the parking of one unoccupied mobile home in an accessory
private garage building, or in the rear yard in any district is permitted,
providing no living quarters shall be maintained or any business practiced in
the mobile home while the mobile home is so parked or stored.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.03  REQUIREMENTS FOR MOBILE HOME PARKS.
   (a)   Drainage.  A mobile home park must be adequately graded and drained to
insure rapid run off.  The grading plan shall be approved by the City Engineer.
   (b)   Minimum Lot Size.
      (1)   Each mobile home unit shall contain not less than 3,600 square
feet.
      (2)   Frontage:  40 feet.
      (3)   Side yard:  20 feet between units.
      (4)   Rear yard:  5 feet.
      (5)   Depth:  90 feet.
      (6)   Front yard:  15 feet.
      (7)   A mobile home must abide by setbacks established when adjacent to a
City street.
   (c)   Driveways and Walkways.  There shall be a hard-surfaced driveway of
not less than twenty-five feet in width and hard-surfaced walkways not less
than three feet in width.  Both shall be adequately lighted.
   (d)   Landscaping.  The required fifteen foot front yard setback of the
mobile home unit shall be adequately landscaped to provide a park-like
appearance for the land and the mobile home.
   (e)   Automobile Parking.  There shall be at least two parking spaces for
each unit on the unit site.  Parking shall be on a concrete pad.
   (f)   Utilities.  All utilities must be underground per the City Engineer's
specifications.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.04  PERMITTED ACCESSORY USES AND BUILDINGS.
   (a)   Accessory buildings or structures containing service facilities
including the following and similar uses are permitted:
      (1)   Wash room, laundry facilities.
      (2)   Recreation facilities limited to those serving occupants of the
park.
   (b)   An accessory building or structure containing no more than one
dwelling unit for use by the manager of the park, limited to one such building
or structure per park is permitted; such accessory building or structure may
also include an office for management of the park.
   (c)   An accessory building or structure for a carport or garage is
permitted.
   (d)   Off-street parking is permitted provided it is abutting and incidental
to another use permitted in this district.
   (e)   Common house pets, provided they are not kept, bred or maintained for
commercial purposes are permitted.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.05  SIGNS.
   (a)   One identification sign or structure of permanent type construction is
allowed.  The total area of the identification sign shall not exceed forty
square feet and shall be limited to eighteen feet in height.
   (b)   One temporary sign for notification of sale, lease or rental of the
premises upon which such sign is placed is permitted.  This sign shall not
exceed four square feet in size.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.06  NONCONFORMING MOBILE HOME PARKS.
   Existing mobile home parks or trailer parks not conforming to the provisions
of this chapter, shall be considered as a nonconforming use and are subject to
the following provisions:
   (a)   Continuation.  The nonconforming use of a mobile home park or trailer
park lawfully existing at the time this section becomes effective (Ordinance
1970-76, passed June 9, 1970) may be continued, except as otherwise provided in
this section.
   (b)   Repairs and Alterations.  A building or structure located within a
nonconforming park or camp may be repaired or altered, and any building,
structure, or portion thereof, declared unsafe by the Chief Building Official,
may be strengthened or restored to a safe condition.
   (c)   Extension.  A nonconforming mobile home park or trailer camp shall not
be expanded, enlarged or extended in any way, unless such expansion is in
accord with the provisions of this chapter.
   (d)   Change of Use.  A nonconforming mobile home park or trailer camp can
have the use of the park or camp if the future use of such land shall be in
conformity with the regulations of this chapter.
   (e)   Discontinuance.  If a nonconforming mobile home park or trailer camp
is discontinued or its normal operation is stopped for a period of one year,
the use of the land shall thereafter conform to a use permitted in the zone in
which it is located.
      (Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.07  COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER ORDINANCES.
   A mobile home park shall comply with all applicable City ordinances and
regulations.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.08  REVISION OF PLANS.
   If, after final approval of the plan, it is necessary to amend the
development plan, an amended final development plan shall be submitted to the
City Planning Commission for approval.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.09  HEALTH REQUIREMENTS.
   Mobile home parks must meet or exceed minimum laws and regulations as
established by the Ohio Department of Health or Lake County Combined Board of
Health.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed 6-9-70.)
1345.10  DAILY RECORD TO BE KEPT.
   The manager or caretaker of a duly licensed mobile home park shall provide a
registration book and keep a complete daily record of the names and addresses
of the occupants of each mobile home admitted to the mobile home park, the
automobile license and the mobile home license numbers and furnish copies
thereof to the Chief of Police upon demand.  The record shall be subject to
inspection by State, County or City officers.
(Ord. 1970-76.  Passed  6-9-70.)
1345.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the third degree for each offense.  A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
CHAPTER 1347
Signs
